channel.title: Free Paris Audio Guide
channel.description:
AUDIO GUIDE OF PARIS BY CITYZEUM.COM Welcome to one of the first free audio guides of Paris. Main travel sites are commented within our audio tours: Monuments (Tour Eiffel, Arc de Triomphe, Pantheon, Sacre Coeur …), museums (Louvre, Beaubourg, Orsay,…), squares and streets (Concorde, Vosges, Champs Elysees,…), gardens (Bois de Boulogne, Tuileries), statues, districts (Saint Germain, Montmartre, Madeleine, Opera, Marais…). You will be able to access also practical information such as opening times, prices, addresses,…in the detail of each MP3 file. All the sites are independent, which means that you are totally free to organise your trip. If you need itineraries or map, you may access our web site at http://www.cityzeum.com. You want more? 10 hours of audio tours are available for download on our site. Subscribe for free to this Podcast!
Soon, new destinations will be opened : Barcelona, Madrid, London, Brussels, Marrakech, Fes, Goa, Roma, Amsterdam, New-York, Florence, Sicilia, Turkey, Venise, Saint-Petersburg, Moskow, Praha, Vienna, Angkor, Tokyo, Inde du Sud, Rajasthan, Greece, Egypt, Lyon, Lille, Corsica, Chateaux de la Loire, French wine tour, Brittany, Provence, Burgundy, Champagne, Provence, Marseille, Rouen, Reims, Poitiers, Avignon, Aix, Nantes, France, Italie, Ireland, Maroc, World Heritage…
NB : this podcasts are also available in french.
channel.itunes:author: Cityzeum
channel.itunes:subtitle: Free audio guide of Paris

item.title: Tour Eiffel
item.description:
Tour Eiffel. Type:Monument
What to do, what to see around Things to see: The hourly illumination by night The overwhelming view from the tower floors The lifts
Things to do: Go for a trip down the Seine on a Bateau Mouche (literally a "fly boat" or an open excursion boat) Have a picnic on the Champ de Mars Go to the upper floors to admire the view over Paris
A proximité The Champ de Mars The Trocadéro (on the other side of the Seine)
Metro: Champs de Mars Tour Eiffel (C) Address: Champs de Mars District: Tour Eiffel Tel: 0144112323 Fax: Paris Price: 4,10 euros: 1st floor 7,50 euros: 2nd floor 10,70 euros: 3rd floor 3,80 euros: 1st and 2nd floor by stairs Opening Time: 9h - 00h from June to August 9h30 - 23h from September to June
www.cityzeum.com – All right reserved – Travel guides and audio guides to download on iPod, mobile phone, GPS, handheld for main cities in the world : Paris, London, Roma, Barcelona, Amsterdam, Brussels, …
item.itunes:author: Cityzeum

item.title: Arc de Triomphe
item.description:
Arc de Triomphe. Type:Monument
What to do, what to see around Things to See: The tomb of the Unknown Soldier The monument's sculptures The large avenues leading from the Arc de Triomphe The Champs Elysées At 6.30 pm, the flame of the Unknown Soldier is rekindled On the 21st of June, the sun sets in the Arc de Triomphe
Things to do: Ascend the Arc de Triomphe and admire the view which extends from the Louvre to La Défense ("la Voie Royale")
Nearby The place de l'Etoile The Champs Elysées The Avenue Foch The place des Ternes
Metro: Charles de Gaulle - Etoile (1 - 2 - 6 - A) Address: arc de triomphe District: Champs-Elysées - Etoile Tel: 0155377377 Fax: Paris Price: 8 euros Reduced rate: Free under 18 Opening Time: 10h - 23h from April to September 10h - 22h30 from October to March

item.title: Sacre Coeur
item.description:
Sacre Coeur. Type:Monument
What to do, what to see around Things to see: Sacré-Coeur's façade The dome The crypt The view over all of Paris from the parvis The Montmartre quarter
A proximité The place du Tertre Saint Pierre de Montmartre church The Halle Saint Pierre Montmartre wineyards
Metro: Abbesses (12) Address: Place du Sacré-Coeur District: Montmartre Tel: 0153418900 Fax: Paris Price: Dome: 5 euros Opening Time: 9h - 18h

item.title: Concorde (place de la)
item.description:
Concorde (place de la). Type:Squares and Streets
What to do, what to see around Things to see: The square itself and the view over Madeleine, the Assemblée Nationale, the Champs-Elysées and the Tuileries The Hôtel de Crillon The Obelisk The Marly Horses The Concorde bridge
Things to do: Have a drink at the Crillon Visit the boutiques in rue Royale Relax in the Parc des Tuileries nearby Visit the Orangerie and Jeu de Paume museums close by
Nearby The Champs Elysées The Madeleine place and church The Tuileries The colonnade of the Assemblée Nationale
Metro: Concorde (1 - 8 - 12) Address: place de la Concorde District: Concorde Madeleine Fax: Paris
www.cityzeum.com – All right reserved – Travel guides and audio guides to download on iPod, mobile phone, GPS, handheld for main cities in the world : Paris, London, Roma, Barcelona, Amsterdam, Brussels, …
item.itunes:author: Cityzeum

item.title: Musée Louvre
item.description:
Musée Louvre. Type:Museum
What to do, what to see around Things to see: The museum's masterpieces: -La Joconde (The Mona Lisa) -Winged Victory of Samothrace -Venus de Milo -The Sphinx
The Palais du Louvre that hosts the museum - The Colonnade - La cour carrée du Louvre (Square Courtyard of the Louvre) - The Pyramid - The medieval Louvre - The Carrousel shopping arcade
Things to do: Visit the museum, which can last a few hours.... Relax in the Jardin des Tuileries nearby Have a drink or eat at the Café Marly Follow in the tracks of the Da Vinci Code
Nearby The Carrousel du Louvre The jardin des Tuileries The rue de Rivoli The Louvre des Antiquaires
Metro: Palais Royal - Musée du Louvre (1 - 7) Address: Palais du Louvre District: Louvre Tuileries Tel: 0140205050 Fax: Paris Price: Museum : 8,50 euros (6 euros after 18h) Exhibition Hall Napoléon : 9,50 euros Both : 13 euros (11 euros after 18h) Reduced rate: Free under 18 On Friday, from 18h: Free under 26 Opening Time: 9h - 18h, until 21h45 on Wednesday and Friday Closure Day: Tuesday

item.title: Musée Rodin
item.description:
Musée Rodin. Type:Museum
What to do, what to see around Things to see: The works of Auguste Rodin The Hôtel Biron
Things to do: Visit the museum dedicated to Rodin, then take a walk in the park
Nearby: The Hôtel National des Invalides The Hôtel Matignon
Metro: Solférino (12) Address: 75, rue de Varenne District: Invalides Tel: 0144186124 Fax: Paris Price: 5 euros Opening Time: April to September: 09h30 - 17h45 October to March: 09h30 - 16h45 Closure Day: Monday

item.title: Parc Montsouris
item.description:
Parc Montsouris. Type:Garden and Water
What to do, what to see around Things to see: The 1.400 trees The numerous sculptures The Observatoire Météorologique (meteorological observatory) The wooded lanes and villas in the vicinity
Nearby: The Cité-Universitaire (university complex) The Stade Charléty (stadium)
Metro: Cité Universiataire (B) Address: Parc de Montsouris District: Montsouris Fax: Paris Opening Time: 8h/9h - 17h30/21h30

item.title: Sainte Chapelle
item.description:
Sainte Chapelle. Type:Monument
What to do, what to see around Things to see: Stained glass
Nearby The flower Market The Palais de Justice The Conciergerie where Marie Antoinette was jailed Notre-Dame cathedral

item.title: Conciergerie
item.description:
Conciergerie. Type:Monument
What to do, what to see around Things to see: The Salle des Gens d'Armes (people-at-arms), a magnificent Gothic hall of around 2,000 m2. Marie-Antoinette's reconstructed cell The first publc clock in Paris outside the building
Things to do: Visit the Conciergerie
Nearby: The l'Ile de la Cité quarter The Palais de Justice La Sainte-Chapelle Place and Théâtre du Chatelet Place Dauphine
Metro: Cité (4) Address: 1, quai de l'Horloge District: Iles Cité-Saint Louis Tel: 0153406080 Fax: Paris Price: 6,10 euros Reduced rate: Free under 18

item.title: Cortot (rue)
item.description:
Cortot (rue). Type:Squares and Streets
What to do, what to see around Things to see: The oldest house in Montmartre which houses a museum about the hill
Nearby: The Montmartre vines Place du Tertre The Eglise Saint-Pierre de Montmartre (church)
Metro: Lamarck - Caulaincourt (12) Address: rue Cortot District: Montmartre Fax: Paris
